verses.verse: Now the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> came<WH1961> to Jonah<WH3124> the second<WH8145> time,<WH8145> saying,<WH559>
"Arise,<WH6965> go<WH1980> to Nineveh<WH5210> the great<WH1419> city<WH5892> and proclaim<WH7121> to it the proclamation<WH7150> which<WH834> I am going to tell<WH1696> you."

So Jonah<WH3124> arose<WH6965> and went<WH1980> to Nineveh<WH5210> according to the word<WH1697> of the Lord.<WH3068> Now Nineveh<WH5210> was an exceedingly<WH430> great<WH1419> city,<WH5892> a three<WH7969> days' walk.<WH4109>

Then Jonah<WH3124> began<WH2490> to go<WH935> through the city<WH5892> one<WH259> day's walk;<WH4109> and he cried<WH7121> out and said,<WH559> "Yet<WH5750> forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and Nineveh<WH5210> will be overthrown.<WH2015>"

Then the people<WH376> of Nineveh<WH5210> believed<WH539> in God;<WH430> and they called<WH7121> a fast<WH6685> and put<WH3847> on sackcloth<WH8242> from the greatest<WH1419> to the least<WH6996> of them.

When the word<WH1697> reached<WH5060> the king<WH4428> of Nineveh,<WH5210> he arose<WH6965> from his throne,<WH3678> laid<WH5674> aside<WH5674> his robe<WH155> from him, covered<WH3680> [himself] with sackcloth,<WH8242> and sat<WH3427> on the ashes.<WH665>

And he issued<WH2199> a proclamation<WH2199> and it said,<WH559> "In Nineveh<WH5210> by the decree<WH2940> of the king<WH4428> and his nobles:<WH1419> Do not let man,<WH120> beast,<WH929> herd,<WH1241> or flock<WH6629> taste<WH2938> a thing.<WH3972> Do not let them eat<WH7462> or drink<WH8354> water.<WH4325>

"But both man<WH120> and beast<WH929> must be covered<WH3680> with sackcloth;<WH8242> and let men call<WH7121> on God<WH430> earnestly<WH2394> that each<WH376> may turn<WH7725> from his wicked<WH9567> way<WH1870> and from the violence<WH2555> which<WH834> is in his hands.<WH3709>
"Who<WH4310> knows,<WH3045> God<WH430> may turn<WH7725> and relent,<WH5162> and withdraw<WH7725> His burning<WH2740> anger<WH639> so that we shall not perish?"

When God<WH430> saw<WH7200> their deeds,<WH4639> that they turned<WH7725> from their wicked<WH9567> way,<WH1870> then God<WH430> relented<WH5162> concerning<WH5921> the calamity<WH9567> which<WH834> He had declared<WH1696> He would bring<WH6213> upon them. And He did not do<WH6213> [it.]
